column4: flare183, i had to install package esound and set Sound Events to ESD to get sound events to work.... will not work with alsa
you really want ultimate ubuntu
is there any all in one gnome multimedia thing?
that's what totem is
but the consensus is that totem is The Worst Program Ever Written
no... with a library, kinda like rhytembox
you mean that does both music and movies?
yes
hmm, not that I know of..
kinda like windows media player... no offence to anyone
I think the new version of totem is supposed to have library support, or something
will be out in a couple of months
ok.. guess ill just have to wait
which p3p service?
gnutella with build in playback support... if possible
not limewire though
I don't think you'll find one with play-back support
the unix philosophy is generally, "one program, one task" or "do one thing and do it right"
yeah, i can understand that, but gtk-gnutella doesnt even let you launch the song with a different app, you have to open it manually
I think that's the only one out there...most people these days use bittorrent
clients for old p2p networks don't get much attention anymore
there are a slew of them... ktorrent, azureus, deluge, transmission ... it's a personal-taste thing
